    ‘People coming from foster care need to be able to see and hear about good stories so they can start the process of healing’
    

            
            
    One morning 12 years ago, when student Alpha Ike was 11, and his brothers, Victory and Heaven, were 13 and seven respectively, they woke up to discover their mother was gone. “My mom left suddenly and we didn’t know where she went — she left us with a friend in an estate in Cavan town,” remembers Ike.
